019
020package org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer;
021
022import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.DEPRECATED;
023import static org.apiguardian.api.API.Status.STABLE;
024
025import javax.lang.model.element.TypeElement;
026import java.util.List;
027import java.util.Map;
028import java.util.Optional;
029
030import org.apiguardian.api.API;
031import org.tquadrat.foundation.annotation.ClassVersion;
032import org.tquadrat.foundation.javacomposer.internal.ClassNameImpl;
033
034/**
035 *  The specification for a fully-qualified class name for top-level and
036 *  member classes.
037 *
038 *  @author Square,Inc.
039 *  @modified Thomas Thrien - thomas.thrien@tquadrat.org
040 *  @version $Id: ClassName.java 1067 2023-09-28 21:09:15Z tquadrat $
041 *  @since 0.0.5
042 *
043 *  @UMLGraph.link
044 */
045@ClassVersion( sourceVersion = "$Id: ClassName.java 1067 2023-09-28 21:09:15Z tquadrat $" )
046@API( status = STABLE, since = "0.0.5" )
047public sealed interface ClassName extends TypeName, Comparable<ClassName>
048    permits ClassNameImpl
049{
050        /*---------*\
051    ====** Methods **==========================================================
052        \*---------*/
053    /**
054     *  Creates a new instance for an implementation of {@code ClassName} as a
055     *  copy of this one, but with the given annotations added.
056     *
057     *  @param  annotations The annotations.
058     *  @return The new instance.
059     */
060    @Override
061    public ClassName annotated( final List<AnnotationSpec> annotations );
062
063    /**
064     *  Returns a new instance for an implementation of {@code ClassName} for
065     *  the given fully-qualified class name string. This method assumes that
066     *  the input is ASCII and follows typical Java style (lowercase package
067     *  names, UpperCamelCase class names) and may produce incorrect results
068     *  or throw
069     *  {@link IllegalArgumentException}
070     *  otherwise. For that reason,
071     *  {@link #get(Class)},
072     *  {@link #get(CharSequence,CharSequence,CharSequence...)},
073     *  and
074     *  {@link #get(TypeElement)}
075     *  should be preferred as they can correctly create {@code ClassName}
076     *  instances without such restrictions.
077     *
078     *  @param  classNameString The fully qualified class name.
079     *  @return The new class name instance.
080     *
081     *  @deprecated Because of the limitations described above, this method is
082     *      seen as inherently unsafe, and therefore it was decided to
083     *      deprecate it.
084     */
085    @SuppressWarnings( {"ClassReferencesSubclass", "DeprecatedIsStillUsed"} )
086    @Deprecated( since = "0.1.0" )
087    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
088    public static ClassName bestGuess( final CharSequence classNameString )
089    {
090        final var retValue = ClassNameImpl.bestGuess( classNameString );
091
092        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
093        return retValue;
094    }   //  bestGuess()
095
096    /**
097     *  {@inheritDoc}
098     */
099    @Override
100    public int compareTo( final ClassName o );
101
102    /**
103     *  Returns the canonical form of the class name.
104     *
105     *  @return The canonical name.
106     */
107    public String canonicalName();
108
109    /**
110     *  {@inheritDoc}
111     */
112    @SuppressWarnings( "AbstractMethodOverridesAbstractMethod" )
113    @Override
114    public boolean equals( final Object o );
115
116    /**
117     *  Creates a new instance for an implementation of {@code ClassName} from
118     *  an instance of
119     *  {@link Class}.
120     *
121     *  @param  sourceClass The instance of {@code java.lang.Class}.
122     *  @return The respective instance of {@code ClassName}.
123     */
124    @SuppressWarnings( "ClassReferencesSubclass" )
125    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
126    public static ClassName from( final Class<?> sourceClass )
127    {
128        final var retValue = ClassNameImpl.from( sourceClass );
129
130        // ---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
131        return retValue;
132    }   //  from()
133
134    /**
135     *  Returns the class name for the given
136     *  {@link TypeElement}
137     *  instance.
138     *
139     *  @param  element The type element instance.
140     *  @return The new class name instance.
141     */
142    @SuppressWarnings( "ClassReferencesSubclass" )
143    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
144    public static ClassName from( final TypeElement element )
145    {
146        final var retValue = ClassNameImpl.from( element );
147
148        //---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
149        return retValue;
150    }   //  from()
151
152    /**
153     *  Returns a class name created from the given parts.<br>
154     *  <br>For example, calling this method with package name
155     *  {@code "java.util"} and simple names {@code "Map"} and {@code "Entry"}
156     *  yields {@code java.util.Map.Entry}.
157     *
158     *  @param  packageName The package name.
159     *  @param  simpleName  The name of the top-level class.
160     *  @param  simpleNames The names of the nested classes, from outer to
161     *      inner.
162     *  @return The new {@code ClassName} instance.
163     */
164    @SuppressWarnings( "ClassReferencesSubclass" )
165    @API( status = STABLE, since = "0.2.0" )
166    public static ClassName from( final CharSequence packageName, final CharSequence simpleName, final CharSequence... simpleNames )
167    {
168        final var retValue = ClassNameImpl.from( packageName, simpleName, simpleNames );
169
170        // ---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
171        return retValue;
172    }   //  from()
173
174    /**
175     *  Creates a new instance for an implementation of {@code ClassName} from
176     *  an instance of
177     *  {@link Class}.
178     *
179     *  @param  sourceClass The instance of {@code java.lang.Class}.
180     *  @return The respective instance of {@code ClassName}.
181     *
182     *  @deprecated Use
183     *      {@link #from(Class)}
184     *      instead.
185     */
186    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
187    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
188    public static ClassName get( final Class<?> sourceClass ) { return from( sourceClass ); }
189
190    /**
191     *  Returns the class name for the given
192     *  {@link TypeElement}
193     *  instance.
194     *
195     *  @param  element The type element instance.
196     *  @return The new class name instance.
197     *
198     *  @deprecated Use
199     *      {@link #from(TypeElement)}
200     *      instead.
201     */
202    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
203    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
204    public static ClassName get( final TypeElement element ) { return from( element ); }
205
206    /**
207     *  Returns a class name created from the given parts.<br>
208     *  <br>For example, calling this method with package name
209     *  {@code "java.util"} and simple names {@code "Map"} and {@code "Entry"}
210     *  yields {@code java.util.Map.Entry}.
211     *
212     *  @param  packageName The package name.
213     *  @param  simpleName  The name of the top-level class.
214     *  @param  simpleNames The names of the nested classes, from outer to
215     *      inner.
216     *  @return The new {@code ClassName} instance.
217     *
218     *  @deprecated Use
219     *      {@link #from(CharSequence, CharSequence, CharSequence...)}
220     *      instead.
221     */
222    @Deprecated( since = "0.2.0", forRemoval = true )
223    @API( status = DEPRECATED, since = "0.0.5" )
224    public static ClassName get( final CharSequence packageName, final CharSequence simpleName, final CharSequence... simpleNames )
225    {
226        final var retValue = from( packageName, simpleName, simpleNames );
227
228        // ---* Done *----------------------------------------------------------
229        return retValue;
230    }   //  get()
231
232    /**
233     *  {@inheritDoc}
234     */
235    @Override
236    public boolean isAnnotated();
237
238    /**
239     *  Returns a new instance for an implementation of {@code ClassName} for
240     *  the specified {@code name} as nested inside this class.
241     *
242     *  @param  name    The name for the new nested class.
243     *  @return The new instance.
244     */
245    public ClassName nestedClass( final CharSequence name );
246
247    /**
248     *  Returns the package name, like {@code java.util} for
249     *  {@code java.util.Map.Entry}. Returns the empty String for the default
250     *  package.
251     *
252     *  @return The package name.
253     */
254    public String packageName();
255
256    /**
257     *  Returns the enclosing class, like {@link Map} for
258     *  {@code java.util.Map.Entry}. The return value will be
259     *  {@linkplain Optional#empty() empty}
260     *  if this class is not nested in another class.
261     *
262     *  @return An instance of
263     *      {@link Optional}
264     *      that holds the name of the enclosing class.
265     */
266    public Optional<ClassName> parentClass();
267
268    /**
269     *  Creates a class that shares the same enclosing package or class.
270     *
271     *  @param  name    The name of the peer class to create.
272     *  @return The new instance for the peer class.
273     */
274    public ClassName peerClass( final CharSequence name );
275
276    /**
277     *  Returns the binary name of a class, as used by reflection.
278     *
279     *  @return The binary name.
280     */
281    public String reflectionName();
282
283    /**
284     *  Returns the simple name of this class, like {@code Entry} for
285     *  {@code java.util.Map.Entry}.
286     *
287     *  @return The simple name.
288     */
289    public String simpleName();
290
291    /**
292     *  Returns a list of the simple names for this nesting group.
293     *
294     *  @return The simple names.
295     */
296    public List<String> simpleNames();
297
298    /**
299     *  Returns the top class in this nesting group.
300     *
301     *  @return The name of the top level class.
302     */
303    public ClassName topLevelClassName();
304
305    /**
306     *  Creates a new instance for an implementation of {@code ClassName} as a
307     *  copy of this one, but without any annotations.
308     *
309     *  @return The new instance.
310     */
311    @Override
312    public ClassName withoutAnnotations();
313}
314//  interface ClassName
315
316/*
317 *  End of File
318 */
